title: Bryce Canyon National Park: Trees and Shrubs
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Plants     Trees and Shrubs                 Trees and Shrubs        Limber Pine on the Rim Trail on the Fairyland Loop. Photographed by Brian B. Roanhorse 23 September, 2014.        Forests dominate the upper altitudes of the Paunsaugunt Plateau containing white fir-spruce-aspen forest. Bristlecone pine lives in the high limestone knolls. Ponderosa pine and manzanita dominate the middle altitudes. Pinyon pine-juniper forest dominates the lower elevation areas of the park. Gambel oak, cactus and yucca punctuate the lower elevation juniper forest.   Forest health and return to historic density are managed with prescribed fire. In the next few pages you will find information about the many trees and shrubs that populate Bryce Canyon.      Great Basin Bristlecone Pine Ponderosa Pine Limber Pine Colorado Pinyon Rocky Mountain Juniper Greenleaf Manzanita Blue Spruce Douglas Fir Quaking Aspen          Manzanitas during sunrise at Bryce Point. Photographed by Brian B. Roanhorse 28 October, 2015.
